Topic.Title: FPE of 80

Message.Msg: Suicides rates (especially amongst 50+ males) are rising. The propaganda machine known as the financial media is inducing depression amongst those struggling with its incessant propaganda (lies really...) about the state of employment and the economy are making people think it is their fault rather than a broader systemic issue. IMHO they are complicit in the scam and partially responsible for the elevated suicide rates. The failure of the system to hold those responsible to account is what is likely to eventually lead to a change from suicidal tendencies to anger and violent ones. I hope TPTB recognize it is time to change course while there is still a path for a relatively smooth and peaceful transition. They have to give up the excesses and actually earn money from creating value rather than skimming from others. They have to allow balance to return. But, right now, it seems they are playing the infinite leverage takeout game that will only lead to destabilizing outcomes in time...

Topic.Title: Morgan Stanly note hurting AMZN

Message.Msg: Tech - I was reading through Credit Suisse report where they missed the shipping expense line by 30% ($300M) and actually claimed to have nailed it. They put out a huge piece just prior to the Q announcement on how the new fulfillment centers would drive down shipping costs - boy were they wrong. Turns out that even though gas prices were down almost 2% Y/Y shipping expense once again outgew revenue (26% vs 21%). As we have discussed this is related to the ASP declines in the biz that swamp out any advantage the fulfillment centers may be offering. So, go spend $Billions on FC's, fact is the economics are like quick sand for AMZN and will eventually suffocate them.
